Description: Amuletic string: the original twisted and knotted flax fibre thread, now in two pieces, on which are threaded a sliced 'Nassa' shell, one long convex bicone dark-blue glazed composition bead and four amulets. The amulets, three of them of turquoise-blue glazed composition, the fourth of green and blue, consist of an arrow-head (?), a small fiddle-shaped human figure or possibly Ptah-Sokar, a hawk or vulture on a stand and a debased Taweret amulet (Brunton's 21M4).
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Dr David George Hogarth
Curator's comments: Possibly once a single string with 1907,0511.504. Bibliography: Register and Diary of D.G. Hogarth's excavations at Asyut, 1907, and Report to the Trustees of the British Museum, all in MSS.
Bibliographic references: Andrews 1981 / Catalogue of Egyptian Antiquities. Jewellery I (262)
